title_full: SAP15-BP01 Select the optimal compute solution for SAP workloads
title: Select the optimal compute solution for SAP workloads
description: Select EC2 instance types that are certified for SAP workloads and appropriate for your performance requirements. Consider memory-optimized instances for SAP HANA, general purpose instances for application servers, and compute-optimized instances for batch processing workloads.

title_full: SAP15-BP02 Use SAP-certified EC2 instance types
title: Use SAP-certified EC2 instance types
description: Deploy SAP workloads on EC2 instance types that are certified by SAP for production use. Refer to SAP Note 1656099 for the current list of certified instances and their SAPS (SAP Application Performance Standard) benchmarks.

title_full: SAP15-BP03 Right-size SAP workloads based on performance data
title: Right-size SAP workloads based on performance data
description: Use SAP performance data from transaction ST03N, Early Watch reports, and AWS monitoring to right-size SAP instances. Leverage AWS Compute Optimizer recommendations combined with SAP-specific sizing considerations to optimize instance selection.

title_full: SAP16-BP01 Select optimal storage solutions for SAP workloads
title: Select optimal storage solutions for SAP workloads
description: Select storage solutions that meet SAP performance requirements including IOPS, throughput, and latency. Use Amazon EBS io2 Block Express or gp3 volumes for SAP HANA data and log volumes, and consider Amazon FSx for shared file systems.

title_full: SAP16-BP02 Configure Amazon EBS volumes according to SAP HANA KPIs
title: Configure Amazon EBS volumes according to SAP HANA KPIs
description: Configure Amazon EBS volumes to meet SAP HANA storage KPIs for read/write latency, IOPS, and throughput. Use striped volume configurations where necessary and validate performance using SAP HANA hardware configuration check tool (hwcct).

title_full: SAP16-BP03 Use Amazon FSx for shared SAP file systems
title: Use Amazon FSx for shared SAP file systems
description: Use Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP or Amazon FSx for Windows File Server for shared SAP file systems including /sapmnt, /usr/sap/trans, and SAP HANA shared volumes. Configure appropriate throughput capacity and storage capacity based on workload requirements.

title_full: SAP17-BP01 Design network architecture for SAP performance
title: Design network architecture for SAP performance
description: Design network architecture that minimizes latency for SAP communications. Place related SAP components in the same Availability Zone where possible, use placement groups for cluster configurations, and select instance types with enhanced networking capabilities.

title_full: SAP17-BP02 Use enhanced networking for SAP workloads
title: Use enhanced networking for SAP workloads
description: Enable enhanced networking on EC2 instances running SAP workloads for higher bandwidth, higher packet per second performance, and consistently lower inter-instance latencies. Use Elastic Network Adapter (ENA) enabled instances for optimal network performance.

title_full: SAP18-BP01 Monitor and optimize SAP database performance
title: Monitor and optimize SAP database performance
description: Monitor SAP database performance using SAP HANA Studio, DBA Cockpit, and AWS monitoring tools. Identify and address performance issues including expensive SQL statements, table statistics, and memory allocation. Implement regular database maintenance procedures.

title_full: SAP18-BP02 Optimize SAP HANA memory configuration
title: Optimize SAP HANA memory configuration
description: Configure SAP HANA memory parameters appropriately for your workload including global allocation limit, statement memory limit, and row store allocation. Monitor memory consumption and adjust parameters based on usage patterns.

title_full: SAP19-BP01 Implement performance monitoring for SAP workloads
title: Implement performance monitoring for SAP workloads
description: Implement comprehensive performance monitoring covering SAP application layer, database layer, and infrastructure layer. Use SAP Solution Manager, Amazon CloudWatch, and third-party monitoring tools to establish baselines and detect performance degradation.

title_full: SAP19-BP02 Establish performance baselines and thresholds for SAP systems
title: Establish performance baselines and thresholds for SAP systems
description: Establish performance baselines for SAP systems including dialog response times, batch job durations, and database query performance. Configure alerting thresholds based on baseline deviations to proactively identify performance issues.
